```{r include = FALSE}
# Load libraries & set plot theme
library(here)
library(tidyverse)
library(ggpol)
```

```{r include = FALSE}
# Set theme for plots
theme_set(theme_classic())
```

```{r include = FALSE}
# Read in cleaned stroke data
activity_hb <- read_csv(here("data/clean/activity_hb.csv")) %>% 
  filter(admission_type == "All")
activity_ca <- read_csv(here("data/clean/activity_ca.csv")) %>% 
    filter(admission_type == "All")
mortality_hb <- read_csv(here("data/clean/mortality_hb.csv"))
mortality_ca <- read_csv(here("data/clean/mortality_ca.csv"))
```

```{r}
# Read in cleaned population data
pop_total_hb <- read_csv(here("data/clean/population_total_hb.csv"))
pop_ages_hb <- read_csv(here("data/clean/population_ages_hb.csv"))
pop_total_ca <- read_csv(here("data/clean/population_total_ca.csv"))
pop_ages_ca <- read_csv(here("data/clean/population_ages_ca.csv"))
```



```{r}
# Summary of total number of stroke discharges by type
activity_hb %>% 
  filter(hb_name == "Scotland"
         & admission_type == "All"
         & age_group =="All" 
         & sex == "All" 
         & year == 2018 ) %>% 
  group_by(diagnosis, sex, age_group) %>% 
  summarise(discharges = sum(number_of_discharges))
```

```{r}
# Summary of total number of stroke deaths by type
mortality_hb %>% 
  filter(hb_name == "Scotland" 
         & age_group == "All"
         & sex == "All"
         & year == 2018) %>% 
  group_by(year, sex, diagnosis) %>% 
  summarise(total_deaths = sum(number_of_deaths))
```

```{r}
# Total discharges split by diagnosis, 2018
activity_hb %>% 
  filter(hb_name == "Scotland"
           & age_group =="All" 
           & sex == "All" 
           & year == "2018"
         ) %>% 
  group_by(diagnosis) %>% 
  summarise(discharges = sum(number_of_discharges)) %>% 
  ggplot() +
  aes(x = reorder(diagnosis, discharges), 
      y = discharges) +
  geom_col(fill = "darkblue") +
  labs(title = "Total number of discharges in Scotland, 2018") +
  theme(axis.title = element_blank(),
        axis.line = element_blank(),
        axis.ticks.y = element_blank()
        ) +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma,
                     limits = c(0, 35000)) +
  coord_flip()
```

```{r}
# Total discharges split by diagnosis, 2018
mortality_hb %>% 
  filter(hb_name == "Scotland"
           & age_group =="All" 
           & sex == "All" 
           & year == "2018"
         ) %>% 
  group_by(diagnosis) %>% 
  summarise(deaths = sum(number_of_deaths)) %>% 
  ggplot() +
  aes(x = reorder(diagnosis, deaths), 
      y = deaths) +
  geom_col(fill = "darkblue") +
  labs(title = "Total number of deaths in Scotland, 2018") +
  theme(axis.title = element_blank(),
        axis.line = element_blank(),
        axis.ticks.y = element_blank()
        )  +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma,
                     limits = c(0, 4500)) +
  coord_flip()
```

```{r}
# Total discharges by sex, diagnosis, age_group
activity_hb %>% 
  filter(hb_name == "Scotland"
           & !age_group %in% c("All", "under75 years") 
           & sex != "All"
           & year == "2018"
         ) %>% 
  group_by(diagnosis, 
           sex,
           age_group
           ) %>% 
  summarise(discharges = sum(number_of_discharges)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = age_group,
             y = discharges,
             fill = sex
             )
         ) +
  geom_col(position = "dodge") +
  theme(axis.title.x = element_blank(),
        axis.title.y = element_blank(),
        axis.ticks.y = element_blank(),
        legend.position = "bottom",
        legend.title = element_blank()
        ) +
  labs(title = "Total number of discharges in Scotland, 2018") +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +
  scale_fill_manual(
    values = c(
      "Male" = "darkblue",
      "Female" = "skyblue"
    )
    ) +
   theme(axis.title = element_blank(),
        axis.line = element_blank()        
        ) +
  coord_flip() +
  facet_wrap(~ diagnosis)
    
```

```{r}
pop_ages_hb %>% 
  filter(year == 2018 
         & sex != "All" 
         & hb_name == "Scotland") %>% 
  group_by(sex, age_band1) %>% 
  summarise(total_pop = sum(count)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = age_band1,
             fill = sex,
             y = ifelse(test = sex == "Male",
                        yes = -total_pop,
                        no = total_pop)
             )
         ) + 
  geom_bar(stat = "identity") +
  theme(axis.title = element_blank(),
        axis.line = element_blank(),
        axis.ticks.y = element_blank(),
        legend.position = "bottom",
        legend.title = element_blank()
        ) +
  labs(title = "Population of Scotland, 2018") +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("Male" = "darkblue","Female" = "skyblue")) +
  scale_y_continuous(breaks = c(-200000, -100000, 0, 100000, 200000),
                     labels = c("200k", "100k", "0", "100k", "200k")) +
  guides(fill = guide_legend(reverse = TRUE)) +
  coord_flip() 
```

```{r}
# Mortality rates
mortality_hb %>% 
  filter(hb_name == "Scotland"
           & !age_group  %in% c("All", "under75 years") 
           & sex != "All" 
           & year == "2018"
         ) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = age_group,
             y = easr,
             colour = sex)) +
  geom_point(fill = "white",
             size = 4,
             alpha = 0.7) +
  coord_flip() +
  theme(axis.title = element_blank(),
        axis.line = element_blank(),
        axis.ticks.y = element_blank(),
        legend.position = "bottom",
        legend.title = element_blank()
        ) +
  scale_colour_manual(values = c("Male" = "darkblue","Female" = "skyblue")) +
  labs(title = "Standardised Mortality Rates, Scotland 2018",
       subtitle = "deaths per 100,000, using European Standard Population") +
  facet_wrap(~ diagnosis, scales = "free_y", ncol = 2)
```


```{r}
# Health board population
pop_total_hb %>% 
  filter(year == 2018 
         & sex == "All" 
         & age == "all_ages"
         & hb_name != "Scotland") %>% 
  group_by(hb_name) %>% 
  summarise(total_pop = sum(count)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = reorder(hb_name, total_pop),
             y = total_pop)) +
  theme(axis.title = element_blank(),
        axis.line = element_blank(),
        axis.ticks.y = element_blank()
        ) +
  labs(title = "Health board populations, 2018") +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma,
                     limits = c(0,1300000)) +
  geom_col(fill = "darkblue") +
  coord_flip()
```


```{r}
# Health Board comparison

mortality_hb %>% 
  filter(age_group == "75plus years"
           & sex == "All" 
           & year == "2018"
           & diagnosis == "Stroke"
         ) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = reorder(hb_name, easr),
             y = easr,
             group = hb_name)) +
  geom_point(size = 3,
             colour = "darkblue") +
  geom_segment(aes(x = reorder(hb_name, easr), 
                   xend = reorder(hb_name, easr), 
                   y = 0, 
                   yend = easr),
                   linetype="dashed", 
                   size = 0.1) +
  theme(axis.title = element_blank(),
        axis.line = element_blank(),
        axis.ticks.y = element_blank()
        ) +
  labs(title = "Standardised stroke mortality rates, age 75+ 2018",
       subtitle = "deaths per 100,000, using European Standard Population") +
  coord_flip() 
```
